content.description:
This one is pretty good. The ledge area below is referred to as Sahkanaga ledge.  

 Sah-ka-na-ga:

 "Cherokee Indian Legend states that a Cherokee Chieftain named the Table Rock Watershed “Sah-ka-na-ga”.  When he finished hunting, he would stop here and use the Table Rock mountain as his dining table while sitting on Stool Mountain to dine on his venison"-The Table Rock State Park web site

 Three bolts to anchors, follow the obvious seam, shares anchors with the two other climbs to the right(not shown in photo Vicarious vibes 5.7 and Ooleny Oddity 5.10+ ). Follow the seam to the top if you really want to P2.
content.location: This is on the far right upper side of table town, you will likely want to approach this via portal pitch or just right of portal on top of the block(one bolt over there), you can also hike up the right side gully but be prepared to fight the bushes(don't do that).

content.description: Starts at low bolt, then straight up, 200' to anchors
content.location: Left of drippy drainage. Left of New Perspectives.

content.description:
P1 5.5 :  Start this route in the mega block corner, feel free to clean up the dead pine and vines at the base.  The entry corner is very easy and well protected 5.5 at hardest.  Make a trad anchor if you need, P2 5.2 R Continuing up and linking pitches is better(p1&p2), however, gear is sparse on this 5.2 slab.  Eventually you will find a two bolt anchor just below the upper headwall.  Alternate finish, you can bail right into the Sah-ka-na-ga area ledge 30ft before this two bolt anchor.  

 P3 5.7/5.8 After the two bolt anchor you can go right up a steeper groove at around 5.8 pg-13 or left/straight at about 5.7. Both ways have a very short crux then return to 5.easy climbing. Both ways will get you to the top around the right side of the tree island.

  I usually bush whack to the main hikers trail from here but I'm sure you could rap off top trees, to two bolt anchor.From the two bolt anchor either set a twin rope rappel to the ground or make a second rap off the tree in the Sah-ka-na-ga area to the ground with a single line.
content.protection: TRAD, start around the corner right on top of the block if it is wet, look for one bolt
content.location: look for the obvious large block corner, this route is on the right side of the Table town area.

content.description: P1: 5.7 200 ft. Stick clip high first bolt or walk over to it from the right. Or just go for it. Mostly bolts, but one small piece (nut, tricam, or even a small cam) is needed halfway up between two farther apart boltsP2: 5.5 190 ft. Trends up and left to anchors.
content.protection: Bring a small rack to a #1. Two 60M needed to rap or see topo. bolted anchors
content.location: This is the long slab/ prow right of the drippy drainage that’s right of the Hostage.

content.description: Start on Sabotage (with bolt), or the line of holes 15' right of that bolt. Flake to anchors, then up groove for P2.
Climb line of holes to corner to anchors (same as negotator). P2 climbs corner to goove.
Between the Main Wall of Table Rock and Pumpkintown proper
